item.title: Eurovision Winning Probabilities
item.author: jkrijthe@gmail.com (Jesse Krijthe)
item.description: This week marks the 62nd edition of the Eurovision Song Contest: an annual event where countries from across Europe and beyond (Australia is competing as well) come together to perform 3 minute pop songs. Predicting the outcome of the contest poses an interesting statistical problem since the rules of the competition have been relatively stable over the years, so there is some data to base future predictions on, yet there is only a single contest every year, making it easy to overtrain a model on the limited data available.
